channel.title: Shell on Anohba Jehad

item.title: Meet Jenkins: A Guide to Automation
item.description:
What is Jenkins?

Jenkins is an open-source automation tool written in Java. It helps developers build, test, and deploy their software automatically, making Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) possible.

CI: Continuous Integration
Automatically building and testing code whenever changes are pushed. 
CD: Continuous Delivery
 Automatically deploying/releasing the code to production or staging. 

Together, CI/CD makes your workflow faster, safer, and hands-free.

In simple terms:

Jenkins watches your code and runs jobs (like building or testing) whenever you push changes — saving you tons of manual work.

item.title: Behind the Prompt
item.description:
If you’ve ever used a Linux terminal or written a script to automate tasks on a Unix-like system, you’ve already brushed up against the world of shell scripting. But there’s one term that often floats around with little explanation, the POSIX shell. What is it, and why does it matter?

What Is a Shell?

A shell is a program that provides a command-line interface (CLI) for users to interact with the operating system. There are many types of shells, including:

item.title: Oh My Zsh!
item.description:
“Zsh isn’t just a shell—it’s your terminal’s upgrade to first class.” If you’re someone who spends time in the terminal—whether you’re a developer, a student learning CLI, or a curious explorer—your shell environment is more than just text on black. It’s your workspace, your command center, your vibe.

What is Zsh?

Zsh (Z Shell) is a powerful, interactive shell and scripting language for Unix-like systems. It’s like Bash’s cooler, more customizable sibling—think of it as Bash after a glow-up.

item.title: Shell Shocked? Try Fish!
item.description:
When it comes to shells, most of us are familiar with Bash, the default shell in many Linux distributions. However, for those looking for a more user-friendly, modern experience, Fish Shell is a great alternative.

What is Fish Shell?

Fish, which stands for Friendly Interactive Shell, is a user-friendly shell designed to be easy to use and understand for both beginners and advanced users. Unlike other shells like Bash, Zsh, or Tcsh, Fish prioritizes simplicity, intuitive features, and efficiency. It’s often regarded as one of the most modern shells for Linux and macOS systems.
